news_header: Freddie Mac reports a rise in 30-year fixed-rate mortgage rates to 6.44% as of October 17, 2024, indicating a strong economy.
news_text: According to Freddie Mac's Primary Mortgage Market Survey, the average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage (FRM) has increased to 6.44% as of October 17, 2024, marking the third consecutive week of rising rates. Chief Economist Sam Khater noted that while rates are higher, they remain over one percentage point lower than a year ago, providing potential homebuyers an opportunity to benefit by comparing quotes from different lenders.
